title: Lagrange's Theorem
description: For a finite group G and subgroup H, the order of H divides the order of G. Fundamental to group theory.

overview.historicalContext: Lagrange proved this in 1771 while studying permutation groups. One of the first major results in group theory.
overview.problemStatement:
**Lagrange's Theorem**:

$$|H| \text{ divides } |G|$$

for any subgroup H of finite group G.
overview.proofStrategy: Partition G into cosets of H. Each coset has size |H|, so |G| = |H| Ã— [G:H].
keyInsights: Each coset has the same size

conclusion.summary: Lagrange's theorem is verified with corollaries about element orders.
